This is because the _journalDiskSync configuration directly affects the system performance at the system level by determining the synchronization behavior of the journal disk writes. Depending on the value of _journalDiskSync, the frequency and efficiency of disk synchronization can vary significantly, leading to notable performance variations in terms of execution time and memory consumption.
